page.title: 03THE FOSTER BROTHERS
page.content: In 1830 two Foster brothers started a worsted business, distributing the work to hand-loom weavers in their own homes. In February 1831{Benjamin {Foster}aged 22, was returning over the moors with cloth when his horse and cart fell in a ditch during a bad snow storm. Struggling along on foot he fell and later died. His faithful dog Shep was still with his master when found by rescuers next day. This is recalled on Benjamin's gravestone in the Wesleyan graveyard. Despite misfortune with gale and fire damage{a new spinning mill and {warehouse }was built in 1857, employing over 1,500 people. The Foster family, living at Waterloo and Whiteshaw, built many cottages, supplied gas and donated generously to the village.
